summary: An Ordinance providing for the improvement of the alley in Block Seventy-six (76), A. A. Denny's Extension to Terry's Addition to the City of Seattle, lying between Ninth Avenue and Terry Avenue, and Madison Street and Spring Street, all in the City of Seattle, by grading the same in accordance with Resolution No. 174 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor by the mode of "Payment by Bonds," as provided by an act of the Legislature of the State of Washington entitled "An act authorizing the issuance and sale of bonds by cities, to pay for local improvements, providing for the payment thereof, and declaring an emergency," approved March 14, 1899, and Ordinance No. 5693 of said city, approved December 6, 1899.
